name: RemoveTaskDependencies
description:
Unlink dependencies from a specified task on Asana.

Use this tool to remove a set of dependencies from a given task in Asana. Requires 'tasks:write' access scope.

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the task to operate on for removing dependencies.

parameters.name: task_dependency_ids_to_remove
parameters.description: An array of task GIDs representing dependencies to be removed from the specified task.

value_schema.description: An array of task gids that a task depends on.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Set to true to receive a formatted, readable response. Useful for debugging, but increases response size and time.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.

parameters.name: opt_pretty
parameters.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

parameters.name: data.dependencies
parameters.description: An array of task gids that a task depends on.

value_schema.description: An array of task gids that a task depends on.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
